user.bio: Constantly searching for new beers, no point stopping now?!

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 450 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 91!

Everyone loves fresh beer, but obviously not as much as you do. You went straight to the source. 

That's a beer at 100 different venues categorized as a Brewery, Cidery or Meadery. Visit 5 more for Level 21!

items.checkin_comment: Malty IPA low on the dank.
Lots of grapefruit on the nose with a high bitterness on the finish

items.badge_description: Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 405 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 82!

user.location: Adelaide, South Australia via old London Town

user.bio:
Untappd Moderator (M2) Melbourne, Australia. 
Please only tag me if I'm having a beer with you.
Chef/Storeman , sneaker collector, vinyl head, craft beer bloke! Milwaukee Bucks n Ess. Bomber!
A Kwozzie with a taste for the great, different & strange brews.

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 20 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%. Try 5 more for Level 5!

When a single isn’t enough, make it a double. Doubling the hops and malts in a recipe results in a higher ABV and can pack quite a boozey punch. That's 5 different beers with the style that contains Imperial / Double in its style name. Try 5 more for Level 2!

user.bio: Just a ordinary guy in search for extraordinary beers

items.badge_description: When a single isn’t enough, make it a double. Doubling the hops and malts in a recipe results in a higher ABV and can pack quite a boozey punch. That's 210 different beers with the style that contains Imperial / Double in its style name. Try 5 more for Level 43!

items.checkin_comment: For a DIPA this was quite watery. Tasty with a side of bitter aftertaste.
Nice nose. Hoppy manky start and middle. Bitter drying aftertaste.

items.badge_description: We believe in IPA and you should too. You certainly have a taste for the hops! That's 365 different IPAs. Try 5 more for Level 74! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast
